resources.string: Department of Electrical Engineering and Electronics

The app is about sensor fusion and is intended as an illustration of what sensor capabilities of any smartphone that run android have. Graphs of the main sensors can be watched in real time, except for video, microphones and radio signals. For further processing, the logged data should be easily transferable to any computer and accessed by other software such as Matlab.
1. Sensors \nGraphs in real time can be seen for the following sensors: accelerometer, gravity, gyroscope and magnetometer.

2. Record Data \nAccelerometer gyroscope and magnetometer are the main sensor options to be chosen. The user can select and record in real time any combination of sensors. \nThe data will be then saved in the internal memory of the phone. Some users might need to boot their smartphone to access the data.
3. Available Sensors \nThis is a list generated automatically by the app. The list is meant to display all the sensors that can be found on the presented device.
4. Lantern \nThis is just a nice to have feature designed to make the app more friendly.
For any inquiry email me at: andreirdv97@gmail.com
